Description: Body sherd of Western Nile Delta (?) pottery closed vessel, possibly an amphora or oinochoe; brownish red fabric core sandwiched between dark brick red inner margins and pale brownish red outer margins, with numerous mica and limestone inclusions; exterior: traces of a dark red slip.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (Nau 176)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IB.096)
